author: Sunitha Sekar
text:
A toll-free number for the Chennai airport may soon passengers to access information.

Airport director Deepak Shastri said, “We are working on starting the toll-free number soon. There is some work left to be done before it gets launched. Passengers will be able to get information related to flight details and other such details.”

It is not clear if the toll-free number will also serve to take complaints, sources said.

K. Neha, a first-time flier said she found it difficult to get any flight-related information when she travelled to Delhi sometime ago.

“I wanted to check if my flight was on time because I heard flights were delayed due to fog in Delhi. But I couldn’t get through to the airlines counter number for a long time. Of course, I hear airlines do send information by text messages most of the time but I lost my mobile and was dependent on landline temporarily. So, in such situations, a toll-free number would be of great help,” she added. Another passenger S. Kannabiran said the toll-free number should have a facility to incorporate passenger-related complaints.
title: Toll-free number soon for airport
